adjective.description: Of, affecting, or belonging to a particular person rather than to anyone else.
examples: her personal fortune was recently estimated at $37 million

adjective.description: Of or concerning one's private life, relationships, and emotions rather than matters connected with one's public or professional career.
examples: the book describes his acting career and gives little information about his personal life

adjective.description: Of or denoting one of the three persons.
Existing as a self-aware entity, not as an abstraction or an impersonal force.
examples: he rejected the notion of a personal God

noun.description: An advertisement or message in the personal column of a newspaper; personal ad.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin personalis of a person, from persona (see person).
